data.title: [yaml] string with = and '{',',' break syntax highlighting
data.body:
Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1550 and should probably be reported to https://github.com/textmate/yaml.tmbundle/ ...but given all the defects, it might just be better to adopt [Atom's YAML grammar](https://github.com/atom/language-yaml/tree/249fdeed7877ccdcba123645f32cc6597bce4b37), since it doesn't have all these bugs

Here are a couple of examples:

```
- blue: a="brown,not_brown"
- not_blue: foo
```

and

```
- blue: foo="}"
- not_blue: 1
```

This is very common in ansible playbooks.

data.title: Git editor and -w / --wait mode for Code
data.body:
**Assignees:**
- [x] Windows @SofianHn
- [x] OS X @joaomoreno 
- [x] Linux @jrieken  

We added a new command line option `--wait` that makes sure the command only returns after the Code window is closing. This is useful in scenarios where you want to use Code as editor for other tools (e.g. Git)
- verify the command line option makes the command line only return when the window closes or the application exits
- verify this works both when Code is not yet running as well as when Code is running
- play around with configuring Code as editor for git to see how this works (see below)
- verify you get coloring for `git commit` message, `git add -p` patches and `git rebase` interactive

**Configure Code for Git**
There are some areas where it makes sense to use Code for Git
- `git config --global -e` allows you to edit git config with Code
- `git rebase HEAD~3 -i` allows to interactive rebase using Code
- `git commit` allows to use Code for the commit message
- `git add -p` followed by <kbd>E</kbd> for interactive add
- `git difftool <commit>` allows to use Code as diff editor for changes

From the command line run `git config --global -e` and make sure to have the following entries

``` ini
[core]
    editor = code-alpha --wait
[diff]
    tool = default-difftool
[difftool "default-difftool"]
    cmd = code-alpha --wait --diff $LOCAL $REMOTE
```

Note: you will need `code-alpha` on the `PATH` (you can use F1 to install)

data.title: [folding] Make it more obvious where a region is collapsed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: After coming back to some code after a few hours, I had forgotten that I collapsed a method. It was not obvious where the region was after spending a moment scrolling up and down the file a couple times looking for the method. The little plus sign, and really faint ellipsis, just isn't enough and is probably why VS puts a big white box around their ellipsis symbol. A horizontal line across the editor might also work (if multiple lines are collapsed).

data.title: Install extension with HTTP Proxy with Basic authentification not working
data.body:
Hello,
trying to use proxy settings with basic authentification `http://user1:mypa$$1@proxy1.company.com:3128` results in errors .

Looking into dev tools I see entries similar to this one:

``` javascript
connect EAFNOSUPPORT 10.0.1.1:3128 - Local (undefined:undefined): Error: connect EAFNOSUPPORT 10.0.1.1:3128 - Local (undefined:undefined)
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:837:11)
    at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:860:20)
    at connect (net.js:838:14)
    at net.js:981:7
    at GetAddrInfoReqWrap.asyncCallback [as callback] (dns.js:62:16)
    at GetAddrInfoReqWrap.onlookup [as oncomplete] (dns.js:81:10)e.onUnexpectedError @ /C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:113
/C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:27 WARNING: Promise with no error callback:7
```

other programs that use http_proxy/https_proxy environment variables work with the current env settings(ex curl).
Does someone have a clue?

data.title: tsserver version should not be shown in the status bar
data.body:
IMHO, it acts as a confusion. Is it the version of the language (i.e. ES6), is it the version of vscode (since it sits next to the smily). Does it add any value to the average user? Do most people use Salsa in other contexts than VSCode? Probably not, therefore, they don't need to know the version. Maybe only show it on hover or something?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/13698039/d88a2640-e771-11e5-9829-a6e33fea6a6a.png)

data.title: Leak testing
data.body:
- [x] @jrieken 
- [x] @SofianHn 

Use the Chrome profiler's snapshot feature to identify leaks for important scenarios:
- [x] open/close an editor
- [x] use code assist
- [x] type into an editor
- [x] search
- [x] git push, pull
- [x] output
- [x] extension host
- [x] quick open etc

data.title: [0.10.10][Windows] Tab size is not working properly
data.body:
I'm using the latest version on my Windows machine, the tab size setting is totally broken. Even though the default setting is 4, the output of Tab on my VS Code is always 8.

For instance, I added a new line starting with two tabs

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/13697428/686a4f84-e7a8-11e5-9bdf-de34cadccd19.png)

VS Code takes these two tabs as 8 spaces (4 for each). However if you open the file in notepad or run `git diff` against the file, you'll see it's not the case

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/13697477/a1380842-e7a8-11e5-90d0-e3e0f9753d0c.png)

Lastly, if we change the tab.size to 2 characters in `setting.json`, CTRL-S the setting file. The tab changes to 2 chars immediately, But once you move your cursor to the left side document, it will revert back real quick.

![vscode-tab-broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/13697624/97708ae0-e7a9-11e5-8d01-50a03253c2bb.gif)

The biggest disappointment is no matter what I set in `setting.json`, a tab is always 8 spaces in the final output.

> 2. Open folder into VS code which contains multiple projects.

Note: Resolve all the error to get project count in the status bar.
run commands > "dnu restore" and "dnx web" in node command prompt and open folder in VS code.
1. verify status bar should show correct project count.(In my case it is showing 2)
2. Try to navigate to different projects by clicking on project count (showing in the status bar).

Actual: Project tree structure in the explorer is broken.
Expected: Tree structure should be displayed properly and it should not break with user's action.
![treestructurebroken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13697335/94fd3d72-e721-11e5-85c3-7765641f7b16.jpg)

data.title: File watcher resulting in high CPU use on Mac/Linux for large folders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
We are using chokidar for file watching. Chokidar is known for performing bad over large folders (see https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar/issues/410). To investigate:
- can we consume a newer version of chokidar with the scalability issue fixed
- can we change our watching strategy to only watch what we need instead of always watching root
- can we switch to another watching library that is more efficient

**Workaround**:
Find the large folders in your workspace and add them under the `files.watcherExclude` setting

data.title: Caret position is wrong after select a candidate from auto-complete for Powershell New-object cmdlet
data.body:
Here are the steps to repro.
1. Launch VSCode
2. Change the mode to Powershell
3. Type `$obj = New-Object ""`
4. Move the caret between double quotations.
5. Type`system.col`
6. Auto-complete shows Collections (For System.Collections)
7. Choose it

Expected:
"Collections" will be inserted and the caret will be moved just before the second double quotation. 

Actual:
"Collections" is inserted but the caret remains the same position.

Note:
VS Version 0.10.10

data.title: Travis errors often due to Github request limit for vscode.d.ts
data.body:
With the new method of fetching `vscode.d.ts` during `npm install` my Travis CI builds error because of exceeding the GitHub API rate limit. This becomes very irritating. I am unsure if this is an problem with how Travis' servers connect to GitHub (seems unlikely due to their relationship) or how `node_modules/vscode/npm/install` requests the file. Possibly requesting the file from a different hosting solution may be an option as well.

Here is my Travis CI page https://travis-ci.org/tht13/gerrit-vscode

See the error below, Travis attempts `npm install` 3 times before giving up.

```
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install
Detected VS Code engine version: ^0.10.8
Error installing vscode.d.ts: Error: Expected an array of tags, but received: {"message":"API rate limit exceeded for 52.0.240.122. (But here's the good news: Authenticated requests get a higher rate limit. Check out the documentation for more details.)","documentation_url":"https://developer.github.com/v3/#rate-limiting"}
```

data.title: [theme] Dark+ and Light+ should support git commit message scopes
data.body:
Once https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3876 is implemented, the following scopes will be available for themes in git commit messages.
- `git-commit.deleted`
- `git-commit.changed`
- `git-commit.inserted`

Example:

```

# Please enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting
# with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.
# On branch master
# Your branch is up-to-date with 'origin/master'.
#
# Changes to be committed:
#   modified:   a
#   deleted:    b
#   new file:   c
#
```

data.title: Fixes #3650: Support stop-all-threads mode debugging for multi-thread…
data.body: As discussed in #3650, this adds support for stop-all-threads mode by adding a flag to the StoppedEvent that the debug adapter sends. Here's the fix in action: I tested this change with a basic multi-threaded program, and verified: - [x] Expanding threads that are not the one that sent the stopped event triggers a query for their callstack - [x] Already expanded threads get updated when a new stopped event is sent - [x] Node debugging works (including debugging VSCode extensions) - [x] Mono debugging works (handling multiple threads work as before) - [x] Go debugging works (handling multiple threads work as before) - [x] C# debugging works (with the new omnisharp-based extension)

data.title: Open folder should start the folder picker at the current folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently when selecting open folder it always opens the folder picker at `$HOME` on Linux. It would be much more convenient if it started in the current folder, that way I can navigate to a relative project very easily like so:
- <kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd>
- (type name of desired project)
- <kbd>enter</kbd>, <kbd>enter</kbd>

[VSCodeEndGameTesting-Aditi][Search][Ember] Searching a large folder causes unresponsive window when running Ember serve
data.body:
Using Ember-cli server
Steps:
1. Open an ember app folder in VS Code
2. Run ember serve command in Cmd prompt
3. Go to search menu in VS Code
4. Search "welcome"
5. Nearly hangs VS Code window and is very slow when loading files

It seems like it is not filtering out files generated by the server, or the search returns too many results when it usually restricts the number of results.

OS: Windows 10
Version 0.10.12-alpha

Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1

data.title: [CMD prompt] Command line arguments for "Locale" and "extensions disable" is not working as expected (when app is running).
data.body:
OS: Windows10
Build #:0.10.12-alpha

Steps:
1. Install app and change the system language setting from command prompt (I set German).
2. Launch app from command prompt with > code-alpha
3. Add C# extension.
3. Try to launch an app again (different instance) from command prompt with locale argument (below commands).

> code-alpha --locale=de-DE
> Repeat step 3 with below command.
> code-alpha --disable-extensions
1. No action has been performed.

Actual:
1. Looks like it is trying to re-launch an app but no changes reflected on the UI (still displaying in EN-US or extension remains as it is).
2. There is no message on command prompt about the command result: Success, Failed or error.

Note: When there is no instance of an app running and user try to launch from command prompt then it is working properly.

Expected: When user try to launch an app from command prompt  with argument then it should reflect the changes on the fly, instead of forcing the user to close all the active window and re-launch to get the changes.

data.title: provide API for displaying color blocks like in CSS
data.body:
It would be nice if extensions could tell vscode to put those CSS color blocks in custom file formats.

For example I have a function returning all ranges of CSS color codes in my document and just passing that into some function would be all it needs to do.

Making this a proper API would also make it easier if changes are added to the color block like a future option to make it round or a color picker (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/625).

Basically this could be exported for plugin use: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/675317b6b856caa2ccb24ce433306a0983116609/src/vs/editor/contrib/color/browser/color.ts#L146-L156

Right now using the TextDecoration API is really hacky because I need to keep track of used colors, remove them and store every different color as separate TextDecoration object which becomes quite hard to handle.

data.title: editor should ignore line ending edits
Close debug console when debugging is stopped
data.body: I believe this worked in a prior version. Now the debug console stays open even after stopping the debugger. It should automatically close. Also, if the debug console is closed manually it should not reopen when the debugger is restarted since it takes up valuable screen real estate if it is not needed.
